subject: Mental Health
title: ARFID: When Picky Eating Is Serious
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: ARFID: When Picky Eating Is Serious.

hook.text: A child eats only five foods and gags at anything new. It's not just picky eating.

buildup.text: ARFID â€” avoidant restrictive food intake disorder â€” involves extreme food avoidance.

discovery.text: It's driven by sensory sensitivity, fear of choking, or lack of interest in food, not body image.

twist.text: ARFID can cause severe nutritional deficiencies and growth problems in children.

climax.text: It was only added to the DSM in 2013 and is still widely misunderstood.

punchline.text: Not every eating disorder is about wanting to be thin.

quiz.question: How does ARFID differ from anorexia?
options: ARFID is not driven by body image concerns
